thread.title: Record-challenging cold to crash into Northeast this weekend
thread.title_full: Record-challenging cold to crash into Northeast this weekend

author: Jason Samenow
title: Record-challenging cold to crash into Northeast this weekend
text:
By Jason Samenow By Jason Samenow March 9 at 4:49 PM Follow @capitalweather Animation showing the progression of frigid pools of air at high altitudes (blue and green shades) between Friday night and Wednesday night as simulated by GFS model. (WeatherBell.com) 
Following a historically warm February , near-record cold is forecast to spill into the Northeast this weekend. 
Weekend high temperatures may only reach the single digits and teens in many areas. From northeast Pennsylvania to Maine, these will be some of the coldest afternoon highs ever posted at this time of year. 
Forecast highs Saturday Forecast highs on Saturday from National Weather Service. Circled areas are near record lows. (WeatherBell.com) 
Forecast highs Sunday Forecast highs on Sunday from National Weather Service. Circled areas are near record lows. (WeatherBell.com) 
In Caribou, Maine, Saturday’s forecast high is only expected to reach 6 degrees, which would crush its previous lowest high for March 11 of 15. High temperature in @NWSCaribou Maine on Saturday is 6°F Mary Poppins icon is out … prev record low maximum is 15°F … will destroy it. pic.twitter.com/OYHOkpQY1B 
— Ryan Maue (@RyanMaue) March 9, 2017 
Boston’s forecast high in the low 20s on Saturday would hover near the lowest for the date (22 degrees in 1874). Providence and Hartford may also match or best their coldest afternoon temperatures for the date. 
Wind chill temperatures will be brutal — especially early Saturday — hovering in the single digits from Washington to Philadelphia, and well below zero in interior New England. GFS model forecast wind chills Saturday morning. 
Overnight low temperatures Saturday night, likely to drop below zero at high elevations, will probably remain just above record levels in most of the region. However, a few records could fall in Massachusetts, Connecticut and Rhode Island, where they are predicted to fall into the single digits. Forecast lows Sunday from National Weather Service. Circled areas are near record lows. (WeatherBell.com) 
Following the weekend cold spell, a reinforcing shot of cold air is likely to spill into this region late Tuesday into Wednesday, behind a possible storm that could bury it in snow. If significant snow occurs, more record cold would likely occur midweek. [ Winter storm possible   but it is a very difficult forecast ] 
The Mid-Atlantic, including Washington, D.C., isn’t expecting record cold this weekend, but temperatures will plunge 15 degrees below normal. The next seven days in Washington are likely to represent the second coldest week of the winter, and coldest since early January. [ Cherry blossoms could be seriously damaged by upcoming cold snap ] 10-day temperature forecast for Washington, D.C. from European model. (WeatherBell.com) 
The source region for the cold in the Canadian Arctic has witnessed record-challenging cold over the past week. [ Biting cold that set records in Canadian Arctic poised to invade eastern U.S. this weekend ] 
Just today, Eureka, Canada, plummeted to an astonishing minus-56 degrees. & to the N, it's -56 F in Eureka, Canada this morning, adding up to 124 degrees difference ! https://t.co/t3kTeXE3Iy 
— Jesse Ferrell (@Accu_Jesse) March 9, 2017 0
